page.title: 09PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content:
There are several old buildings: {Astley Court}:modern. 1940 after fire {Astley Lodge}:18th century {Branch Oak}:16th century timber/brick {Astley Hall}:18th century {Dukes Farm}:19th century timber/brick 70m N.E. of castle are mounds 18m in diameter plus a ridge - the outline of the former college buildings.
There is a sandstone monument on the side of the Duke of Suffolk's Oak blown down in 1891. This commemorates the site of the oak where the Duke of Suffolk (father of Lady Jane Grey) hid following his rebellion against Mary Tudor and where he was captured.
